triples.name: Autonomous Robot
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on ensuring safe operation of autonomous robotic systems in deployment domains.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics is the core application domain where safety-critical control systems are deployed.

triples.name: Control Theory
triples.relevance: Control theory provides the foundational mathematical framework for safety filter approaches.

triples.name: Control Engineering
triples.relevance: Control engineering techniques are integrated in both traditional model-based and data-driven safety approaches.

triples.name: Barrier Function
triples.relevance: Barrier functions are a key technique for ensuring system trajectories remain within safe regions.

triples.name: Lyapunov Stability
triples.relevance: Lyapunov stability theory provides formal guarantees for safe control system design.

triples.name: Model Predictive Control
triples.relevance: Model predictive control represents a traditional model-based control approach discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Machine Learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning enables the data-driven approaches for safety-critical control that the paper reviews.

triples.name: Autonomous System
triples.relevance: Autonomous systems represent the broader class of systems requiring safety guarantees discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Safety Filter
triples.relevance: The safety filter framework is the unified technical approach proposed by the paper to integrate safety-critical control methods.
